forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 30. Southwest wind 3 to 7 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow likely after 7am. Cloudy, with a high near 38. South wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As night drapes itself over Boston, a layer of clouds looms overhead, softening the city’s details into shadows. The chill in the air—a whisper of the impending winter—hints at a night settling around thirty degrees, reminding all to bundle up and breathe in the sharpness of the season. A gentle southwest wind stirs lazily, suggesting a shiver-inducing stillness as the evening deepens. There’s a sense of quietude, broken only by the distant hum of city life, inviting contemplative moments or the companionship of a favorite book.

Looking ahead to tomorrow, expect the clouds to thicken more substantially, pregnant with the promise of snowfall after daybreak. As the world awakens, flakes may begin their gentle dance from the sky, blurring the edges of a wintry landscape. The temperature will reach around thirty-eight, but the shift in atmosphere will chill the spirits, wrapping the city in a cloak of soft white. This day calls for a well-worn scarf, knit gloves, and perhaps a sturdy umbrella steadfast against light precipitation. Local parks may beckon, if one craves to wander, but consider a warm café for a steaming cup of coffee or tea instead, where soft conversations and the aroma of baked goods provide warmth against the cool encroachment of winter’s embrace.
